about.text:
Welcome to my website!

I created this website in VSCode to showcases projects I have designed, developed, or contributed to over the years. Whether it's an Android app, a full-stack website, or a set of low-level memory management functions in assembly, each project represents a step in my growth as a developer. I enjoy working on all levels accross the stack, and I'm always exploring new languages, paradigms, and problem solving techniques. From low-level systems to high-level designs, I enjoy building solutions from the ground up.

Feel free to explore my work and reach out if you'd like to connect!

Thanks for visiting!

portfolio.name: Noise Nest
portfolio.desc: A soundboard for linux enabling users to bind custom hotkeys to play sound files through a microphone output. Saves users created configurations using TinyXML and loads them at the application start.

portfolio.name: Library Database (Website)
portfolio.desc: A website used to track the inventory of a library. Users can add books to a database and use the search bar to find books by title or author. Books listed can be clicked on to checkout, delete, or edit their data.

portfolio.name: Expense Tracker (Android Application)
portfolio.desc: An Android app used to track expenses and maintain a budget. Log purchases by inputing name, date, cost, and reason. See list of all expenses along with data such as amount spent per day and per month as well as a grand total amount spent.

portfolio.name: oMalloc
portfolio.desc: A set of functions to aid in dynamic memory allocation and heap management written in MIPS assembly language. Allows a user to allocate blocks of memory of a custom size as well as free blocks of memory for future use. Freed blocks of memory are used to store a new block if it is large enough to hold the specified amount of data.

portfolio.name: meTunes
portfolio.desc: A program that plays sound files and music. Features also include pausing, playing a playlist, shuffling or sorting a playlist, and changing volume. My role was quality assurance which involved testing the program, debugging, analyzing user interactions with the software, and communicating necessary changes.
